name: Erdős–Hajnal conjecture
summary: The Erdős–Hajnal conjecture states that for any graph \(H\), there exists a constant \(c>0\) such that every graph \(G\) that does not contain \(H\) as an induced subgraph has either a clique or a stable set (independent set) of size at least \(|V(G)|^{c}\). In simpler terms, forbidding a specific graph pattern as an induced subgraph guarantees the existence of a very large clique or stable set, which is a polynomial-sized substructure. This is a major open problem in graph theory, though it has been proven for some specific graphs \(H\), such as the 5-cycle.
head: a graph has a minimum degree of at least three (\(p\))
tail: it contains a simple cycle whose length is a power of two (\(q\)).
